rounds.category: YOU'VE GOT THE WRITE STUFF, JAMES

clues.text: You wrote the novels "Hawaii" & "Alaska"; too bad you never got around to "Rhode Island"
You met Samuel Johnson May 16, 1763; it was the start of a beautiful friendship
You suffered through glaucoma before publishing "Ulysses" on February 2, 1922, your 40th birthday
In 2011 Oprah sat down with you again--to discuss the fallout from your "Million Little Pieces" scandal
Already a Joan Crawford movie, your "Mildred Pierce" came to TV in a 2011 version more faithful to the book
Before she became a "Pretty Woman" in 1990, she was a pretty girl from Smyrna, Georgia
No wonder she wanted to take a "Midnight Train" back there--she was born in Atlanta in 1944
She was a Junior Miss Georgia before heading for Hollywood & stardom with "The Natural" & "Batman"
This "Queen of Southern Cuisine" was born & raised in Albany, Georgia, where she learned to cook from her grandmother Paul
This actress who went to school in Augusta didn't know 'bout birthin' babies in "Gone with the Wind"
It's not my first time at this public exhibition of cowboy skills, from the Spanish for "cattle ring"
It's from the Old English for simply "woman"; that ain't no lady, that's my this
This word from the Arabic for "weight of 4 grains" is worth its weight in gold
"Growing" from the Italian, this music term means a gradual, steady increase in loudness
This punctuation word (it's from the Greek for "putting in beside" & you're staring right at 2 of 'em)

rounds.comments: (Alex: And we will need the last name from you.)

clues.text: 17th century astronomer Galileo
21st century magician Penn
16th century artist Michelangelo
14th century writer Dante
17th century Dutch master painter Rembrandt

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each country will end with the letter A.)

clues.text: Addis Ababa is the capital & largest city of this African country
Of the countries that fit the category, it stretches farthest east
Its cities include Bong Town & Tubmanburg
In books Precious Ramotswe of the No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency is this country's only female gumshoe
It has ports on the Atlantic & you'll find Namibia on its southern border
When Nancy Pelosi & Maxine Waters go home from the U.S. House, they go to this state
Speaker Boehner goes home to this state, where he put himself through Xavier University working as a janitor
Let us be Barney Frank--the Harvard grad heads home to this state, where he also spent 8 years in its House
With 102 years of combined service, John Conyers & John Dignell of this Midwest state are the House's 2 senior members
When Steny Hoyer is done whip-ping his fellow Democrats, he can head home to this state's 5th District
& the Four Seasons
& the Revolution
+ the Machine
& the Blackhearts
& the Blue Notes
At 33 he drafted the Declaration of Independence
He was 33 when he first exhibited his 32 "Campbell's Soup Cans"
He was 33 when he nailed his 95 theses to the door of the Wittenberg Castle Church
On May 29, 1953 he literally found himself on top of the world, along with his guide
And to think he was 33 when he published his first book, "And to Think That I Saw It on Mulberry Street"
Though not the closest to the Sun, it has the highest surface temperature
Around 1675 Gian Domenico Cassini observed a dark gap in this planet's main rings
Its volcano Olympus Mons is the highest mountain in the solar system
It has the most atmospheric ozone of the 8
Of the 4 giant planets, it's the farthest from the Sun

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will be made up of letters in the word "outside".)

clues.text: Nutritional program to get you back into your old Levi's
Grass & dirt in squares for your new backyard
To put out a fire by pouring water on it
To remove, as from office
Like all fine hotels, New York City's Waldorf Astoria has a presidential one
His assistant & roommate
His archenemy, "the Napoleon of crime"
His address
His "colorful" first case
The instrument on which he's "a very capable performer"
In 1976 "Home Sweet Homer", with Yul Brynner as this wanderer, tied a Broadway record by closing after one performance
For Angola the "CIA World Factbook" gives this figure as 38.76 years, 6 years less than the 2nd-lowest country
This Cadillac SUV is the USA's most stolen car model
Ireland (not us profligate Americans) is ranked highest in amount of this related to GDP: 1,305%
Louis-Antoine was the last of these French heirs apparent; his eventual reign was a brief 20 minutes

rounds.text: Him vs. him: "The Life-Long Feud That Electrified the World" is a book about these 2 men
